quizzes.question: How many content models does HTML5 offer?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The List of Content Models [/h1]

In HTML, elements typically belonged in either the block level or inline content model. HTML5 introduces [b]seven [/b]main content models.

- Metadata
- Embedded
- Interactive
- Heading
- Phrasing
- Flow
- Sectioning 
[note]The HTML5 content models are designed to make the markup structure more meaningful for both the browser and the web designer.[/note]

quizzes.question: Where is the metadata located in an HTML5 document?
quizzes.textContent: [h1]Content Models[/h1] [u][b]Metadata[/b][/u]: Content that sets up the presentation or behavior of the rest of the content. These elements are found in the [b]head [/b]of the document. [i]Elements:[/i] , , ,

quizzes.question: Which content model contains almost all of the others?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Content Models[/h1]

[u][b]Flow content[/b][/u]: Contains the majority of HTML5 elements that would be included in the normal flow of the document.
 
[b][u]Sectioning content[/u]:[/b] Defines the scope of headings, content, navigation, and footers.
[i]Elements[/i]: <article>, <aside>, <nav>, <section> [img id="2546" width="100%"]
[note]The various content models overlap in certain areas, depending on how they are being used.[/note]
